article:
'Market manipulation' is a deliberate attempt to interfere with the free and
fair operation of the market and create artificial, false or misleading
appearances with respect to the price of, or market for, a security, commodity
or currency. Market manipulation is prohibited in the United States under
Section 9(a)(2) http://www.sec.gov/about/laws/sea34.pdf of the
Securities Exchange Act of 1934, and in Australia under Section s 1041A of the
Corporations Act 2001. The Act defines market manipulation as transactions
which create an artificial price or maintain an artificial price for a
tradeable security.
